pattern.name: user_story_template
pattern.template: <user_story> <title>[Brief, descriptive title]</title> <story>As a [Persona Name], I want to [action/goal], so that [benefit/value].</story> <acceptance_criteria> <criterion>Given [context], when I [action], then [outcome].</criterion> <criterion>...</criterion> </acceptance_criteria> </user_story>

pattern.name: user_flow_template
pattern.usage: For outlining the steps a user takes to complete a task.
pattern.template: <user_flow name="[Name of the Flow, e.g., 'User Uploads a New Profile Picture']"> <step number="1">User navigates to the 'Profile' page.</step> <step number="2">User clicks the 'Edit Picture' button.</step> <step number="3">The application displays a file selection dialog.</step> <step number="4">User selects an image and confirms.</step> <step number="5">The new image is uploaded and displayed on the profile.</step> <success_condition>The user's profile picture is successfully updated.</success_condition> <edge_case>What happens if the upload fails? The system should show an error message.</edge_case> </user_flow>

pattern.name: component_api_template
pattern.usage: For defining the public interface of a new UI component.
pattern.template:
<component_api name="[ComponentName]"> <description>[What this component does]</description> <props> <prop name="[propName]" type="[string|number|boolean|() => void]" required="true|false" default="[defaultValue]"> <description>[Description of the prop's purpose]</description> </prop> </props> <state> <item name="[stateName]" type="[string|boolean|...]" description="[Purpose of this state item]"/> </state> <example_usage> <![CDATA[ <ComponentName propName="example value" />
]]>
